prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The winner of a Xiangqi, or Chinese chess, tournament has been stripped of his title after allegations of inappropriate behaviour.

Yan Chenglong has also been accused of cheating by using a communication device analogous to anal beads.

The 48-year-old has been stripped of his title and banned from playing for a year.

However, the Chinese Xiangqi Association (CXA) says it's impossible to prove accusations of cheating.

Xiangqi has been hugely popular across Asia for hundreds of years.

According to the CXA, Mr Yan started drinking with friends in his hotel room shortly after winning the title of "Xiangqi King" at a national tournament held on the Chinese island of Hainan last week.

He then defecated in the hotel bath in an act "that damaged hotel property and violated public order and good morals", said the CXA statement.

The CXA was forced to address rumours circulating online that Mr Yan had cheated using anal beads equipped with wireless transmitters to send and receive signals.

"Based on our understanding of the situation, it is currently impossible to prove that Yan engaged in cheating via 'anal beads' as speculated on social media," the CXA said.

As punishment for bad behaviour, Mr Yan was stripped of his title and banned from playing for a year.

The association did not disclose the amount of prize money Yan was forfeiting, but Xiangqi tournaments often promise winners tens of thousands of yuan (thousands of dollars), according to AFP.
stories: The champion of a high-stakes online gaming competition has been stripped of their title and banned from competing for two years after allegations of unsportsmanlike behavior. Liang Xinyu, a 25-year-old professional gamer, was accused of using a high-tech earpiece to communicate with teammates during a match, giving them an unfair advantage. The gaming community was shocked by the revelation, as Liang was known for their exceptional skills and fair play. The governing body of the game, the International E-Sports Federation, launched an investigation and found that Liang had indeed used the earpiece, which was disguised as a hearing aid. As a result, Liang was stripped of their championship title and banned from competing in any official tournaments for two years. The federation also fined Liang a significant amount of money and required them to complete a community service program to promote fair play and sportsmanship.

The reigning champion of the prestigious underwater treasure hunting competition has been disqualified and banned from participating for three years after allegations of illegal treasure hunting equipment usage. Mei-Ling Wong, a 28-year-old professional treasure hunter, was accused of using a high-tech submersible to reach a previously inaccessible underwater cave, allowing her team to claim the treasure before other teams. The international diving community was stunned by the revelation, as Mei-Ling was renowned for her exceptional skills and adherence to competition rules. The governing body of the competition, the World Underwater Federation, conducted an investigation and confirmed that Mei-Ling had indeed used the submersible, which was disguised as a research vessel. As a result, Mei-Ling was stripped of her championship title and banned from participating in any official competitions for three years. The federation also imposed a hefty fine on Mei-Ling and required her to complete a community service program to promote responsible treasure hunting practices and environmental awareness.

The world's top-ranked rock climber, Alexei Petrov, has been stripped of his title and banned from competition for two years after being accused of using a concealed robotic arm to scale a previously impassable route at the prestigious Mount Olympus climbing festival. The 32-year-old Russian climber, known for his daring ascents and adherence to safety protocols, was caught using the robotic arm to overcome a treacherous section of the route, giving him a significant advantage over his competitors. The International Climbing Federation launched an investigation and confirmed the allegations, leading to Petrov's disqualification and suspension from competition for two years. As part of his penalty, Petrov will also have to complete a community service program focused on promoting safe and sustainable climbing practices, as well as environmental conservation efforts.

The world's top-ranked long-distance runner, Maria Rodriguez, has been stripped of her title and banned from competition for three years after being accused of using a concealed exoskeleton to dominate the prestigious Marathon of the Gods. The 35-year-old Spanish athlete, renowned for her record-breaking performances and dedication to training, was caught using the exoskeleton to maintain a blistering pace and leave her competitors in her dust. The International Athletics Federation launched an investigation and confirmed the allegations, leading to Rodriguez's disqualification and suspension from competition for three years. As part of her penalty, Rodriguez will also have to complete a community service program focused on promoting fair play and sportsmanship, as well as advocating for the rights of marginalized athletes.

The world's top-ranked chess grandmaster, Ivan Petrov, has been stripped of his title and banned from competition for five years after being accused of using a hidden neural implant to dominate the prestigious World Chess Championship. The 42-year-old Russian prodigy, celebrated for his lightning-quick calculations and unwavering focus, was caught using the implant to anticipate his opponents' moves and outmaneuver them. The International Chess Federation launched an investigation and confirmed the allegations, leading to Petrov's disqualification and suspension from competition for five years. As part of his penalty, Petrov will also have to complete a mentorship program focused on developing young chess players and promoting fair play and sportsmanship.

The renowned astrophysicist, Dr. Sophia Patel, has been removed from her position and barred from conducting research for three years after being accused of using advanced artificial intelligence to analyze and predict the behavior of celestial bodies. The International Astronomical Union launched an inquiry and verified the allegations, leading to Patel's dismissal and suspension from research for three years. As part of her punishment, Patel will also participate in a program focused on promoting the importance of empirical evidence, collaboration, and the value of human curiosity in scientific discovery.
